result.execSummary:
The defendant Rocky L Noah #520961 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from deft to Judge re: Count 14 and 26 - APPROVED
6/29/17 - Sentencing Hearing

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:30am
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se
Date and time set for sentencing after successful completion with DEOJ on Ct. 14 & Ct. 26

State says defendant has successfully completed DEOJ agreement on Ct. 14 & Ct. 26 which are both Burglary-PTAC
COURT questions defendant regarding appearing pro se and if would like counsel for today's sentencing hearing
Defendant states he does not want attorney for today's sentencing and would like to proceed without attorney
Defendant is in agreement with state's recommendation for sentencing
COURT enters judgment of conviction on Ct. 14 & Ct. 26
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 14 (Burglary-PTAC): 10 years WSPS- 5 years IC, 5 years ES. Ct. 26 (Burglary-PTAC): 10 years WSPS- 5 years IC, 5 years ES. Both counts concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence currently on. Credit granted for 1,105 days for time already served on both counts.  Deft is eligbible for both prison programming- Challenge Incarceration & Substance Abuse. CONDITIONS of ES: same as Ct. 1 & Ct. 9 sentences- Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete any assessmen, counseling, treatment deemed appropriate by the agent. No contact with T.V. or his residence and no contact with C.G., P.P. M.B., J.T. and D.D. & B.D. and any of their residences.

Sentencing hearing on June 29, 2017 at 10:30 am.

June 19, 2014 - Plea and Sentencing Hearing
for Sentence Credit

dft, preliminary hearing, 6/19/2014
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
of Preliminary Examination

Clerk Shirley.
Case Called: 2:29
Includes: 13CM1292, 13CM1461 and 14CF325
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Def appears in custody with Atty Erik McFarland and Atty John.
2:32 Court adjourns for ADA to get Original Information.
BOTR: 2:38
Waiver of Prelim filed in 14CF325. Information filed, Reading Waived. Court questions defendant as to his understanding and finds the waiver was freely and voluntarily waived and Defendant wishes to proceed to plea and sentencing. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to: 13CM1292>>Count 1 and Count 2>>DRI
13CM1461>>Count 1 and Count 2>>DRI
14CF325>>Count 2, Count 3, Count 4, Count 5, Count 6, Count 7, Count 8, Count 10, Count 11, Count 12, Count 13, Count 15, Count 16, Count 17, Count 18, Count 19, Count 20, Count 21, Count 22, Count 23, Count 24, Count 25, Count 27, Count 28, Count 29, Count 30, Count 31 and Count 32>>DRI.
Amend Count 1 to Burglary/PTAC and delete the Arm Self and Repeater Enhancers.
Amend Count 9 to Delete the Repeater Enhancer
Amend Count 14 to Burglary/PTAC and Delete the Arm Self and Repeater Enhancer
Amend Count 26 to Burglary/PTAC and Delete the Arm Self and Repeater Enhancer
Court grants.
PLEA: Amended Count 1>>Burglary/PTAC>>Guilty
Amended Count 9>>Burglary-Dwelling/PTAC>>Guilty
Amended Count 14>>Burglary/PTAC>>Guilty
Amended Count 26>>Burglary/PTAC>>Guilty
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Victims make statements.
COURT ORDERS: 14CF325>>Count 1>>10 years Prison = 5 years IC and 5 years ES
Consecutive to: Count 9>>10 years Prison = 5 years IC and 5 years ES.
All Concurrent to any other sentence.
Conditions of ES: Absolute sobriety, Assessment/Counseling/Treatment deemed appropriate by the Agent, N/C with TV or his residence and N/C with CG, PP, MB, JT and D&BD and any of their residences.
Count 14 and Count 26>>Deferred Prosecution until the 2 Codefendants cases are closed and defendant cooperates with law enforcement and the DA's office and if successful it will be a concurrent sentence with time served. To be reviewed in 2 years as to the status of codefendants cases-an Agreement has been signed by the parties.
Restitution will be discussed by the Atty's after court today and if there cannot be a resolution to the amount of restitution a hearing will be set. Restitution will be joint and several with IVand DW. Atty's will also provide a stipulation to the Court as to any jail credit. Defendant is eligible for programing.  DNA sample and surcharge and CC.
Defendant remanded to transport to the prison system.
